intro: Purgosea corymbosula, commonly known as the mountain snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, woody stems and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Purgosea corymbosula is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
